page.title: 04DARLINGTON BUSES
page.content: Darlington Buses carry more passengers per bus than any other town in England. There are 56 service buses and 5 services enter our twelve square kilometres. Altogether 20 buses enter our area per hour. These are: Service 2, 3 times per hour, Service 4, 6 per hour, Service 5, 3 per hour, Service 6, 6 per hour, and Service 7, 2 per hour. Darlington buses carry 13,939,142 passengers a year. Although there are only 36.5 miles of bus route, in a year, the buses travel over 1.5 million miles. Darlington buses started in 1904. No profits are made, so the council gives the company Â£300,000 a year subsidy. 218 people are employed by the department. Computers are used to calculate costs. Buses run from 4am to midnight. It costs Â£1.68 a mile to operate. A new single decker bus costs Â£63,000.
